00034 #define MAX_FILENAME_LEN        48
00035 
00036 #define FILE_ACCESS_READ            0x01
00037 #define FILE_ACCESS_WRITE           0x02
00038 #define FILE_ACCESS_READWRITE       0x03
00039 
00040 #define FILE_CREATE_NEW                   0x0010      // create new file. fail if exists
00041 #define FILE_CREATE_ALWAYS                0x0020      // create new file. overwrite existing
00042 #define FILE_OPEN_EXISTING                0x0040      // open a file. fail if doesn't exist
00043 #define FILE_OPEN_ALWAYS                  0x0080      // open a file, create if doesn't exist
00044 #define FILE_TRUNCATE_EXISTING      0x0100      // open a file, truncate to size 0. fail if no exist
00045 
00046 #define FILE_SEEK_FROM_START        0x01  // keep in sync with dbman.h
00047 #define FILE_SEEK_FROM_END                0x02  // keep in sync with dbman.h
00048 #define FILE_SEEK_FROM_CURRENT      0x04  // keep in sync with dbman.h
00049 
00050 // GetFile file attributes
00051 #define FILE_IS_READONLY                        1
00052 #define FILE_IS_DIRECTORY                       2
00053 #define FILE_IS_HIDDEN                          4
00054 #define FILE_IS_NORMAL                          8
00055 #define FILE_IS_ARCHIVE                         16
00056 #define FILE_IS_SYSTEM                          32
00057 #define FILE_IS_TEMPORARY                       64
00058 #define FILE_IS_COMPRESSED                128
00059 #define FILE_IS_OFFLINE                         256

00169 // CompareSGPFileTimes() returns...
00170 // -1 if the First file time is less than second file time. ( first file is older )
00171 // 0 First file time is equal to second file time.
00172 // +1 First file time is greater than second file time ( first file is newer ).
00173 INT32 CompareSGPFileTimes( SGP_FILETIME   *pFirstFileTime, SGP_FILETIME *pSecondFileTime );

00175 // One call comparison of file times, allowing for a certain leeway in cases where
00176 // files times may be slightly different due to SourceSafe of copying
00177 BOOLEAN FileIsOlderThanFile(CHAR8 *pcFileName1, CHAR8 *pcFileName2, UINT32 ulNumSeconds);

00179 //    Pass in the Fileman file handle of an OPEN file and it will return..
